original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields slightly up, spot US dollar Rs312/313
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields edged up Friday amid profit taking after falling in intra-day trade dealer said while the rupee closed at 312/313 to the US dollar.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 15.00/15.50 percent Friday down from 15.25/50 percent
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 14.75/15.00 after trading at 15.00 and was down from 15.00/40 percent
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 14.75/15.00 up from 14.50/60 percent a day aearler
15.01.2028 closed 14.80/15.00 percent after trading at 14.50 percent. (Colombo/July07/2023)
